analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on Pairs

original: Nasaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Naasaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naasaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naasaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ
analyzed: na saṅkiliṭṭham dhammam paṭicca na saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  na asaṅkiliṭṭham dhammam paṭicca na asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na asaṅkiliṭṭha
translated: A corrupted phenomenon is a condition, as condition by way of root-cause condition, for a corrupted phenomenon.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naasaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca nasaṅkiliṭṭho ca naasaṅkiliṭṭho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na asaṅkiliṭṭham dhamma  paṭicca na saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ ca na asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: A non-corrupted phenomenon is a condition, as condition by way of root-cause condition, for a non-corrupted phenomenon. A non-corrupted phenomenon is a condition, as condition by way of root-cause condition, for a corrupted phenomenon. A non-corrupted phenomenon is a condition, as condition by way of root-cause condition, for a corrupted phenomenon and a non-corrupted phenomenon.

original: Nasaṅkiliṭṭhañca naasaṅkiliṭṭhañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na saṅkiliṭṭhañca na asaṅkiliṭṭhañca dhammam paṭicca na saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A corrupted and a non-corrupted phenomenon is a condition, as condition by way of root-cause condition, for a non-corrupted phenomenon. (The rest are condensed.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca sabbattha vitthāro
translated: In the section on root-cause, there are five; in the section on object, there are two; … in the section on result, there is one; … in the section on non-hindrance, there are five. (In all cases, the rest are condensed.)
